channel.title: Vanguard News
channel.description: A Nigerian newspaper and Online version of the Vanguard, a daily publication in Nigeria covering Niger delta, general national news, politics, business, energy, sports, entertainment, fashion,lifestyle human interest stories, etc

item.title: Fuel Crisis: Arewa youths berate Tinubu over Kachikwu
item.dc:creator: Ikenna
item.description:
youths under the auspices of Arewa Intergrity Youth Forum (AIYF), have taken a swipe at the National Leader of the All Progressives Congress, APC, Sen. Bola Tinubu over comments berating the Minister of State for Petroleum, Mr. Ibe Kachikwu concerning the ongoing fuel crisis in the nation.

The post Fuel Crisis: Arewa youths berate Tinubu over Kachikwu appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Leave Buratai and our military alone
item.dc:creator: Ikenna
item.description:
Let me first of all start with acknowledging the efforts of our fallen heroes as we celebrated them last Friday and also pray for Godâ€™s protection to our troops in the front line.

The post Leave Buratai and our military alone appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: ‘Creation of grazing areas will cause more crisis’
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
The commissioner ministry of Agriculture Taraba state Dr. David Ishaya said the state government is yet to be informed on the decision of the federal government to create Cattle Ranches and Grazing areas in Nigeria.

The post ‘Creation of grazing areas will cause more crisis’ appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Ibrahimovic confirms Premier League contact
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
Swedish striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic confirmed Sunday that Premier League clubs have indicated an interest in signing him from French champions Paris Saint-Germain.

The post Ibrahimovic confirms Premier League contact appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Stop giving 13% oil derivation to governors, Ndigbo group tells FG
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
A group called Ndigbo Unity Forum (NUF) has appealed to Federal Government to stop giving the monthly 13 per cent oil derivation fund to state governments in oil producing states.

The post Stop giving 13% oil derivation to governors, Ndigbo group tells FG appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: ‘We, Igbo, are the ones marginalising ourselves’
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
AN All Progressive Congress, APC Chieftain, Comrade Chinedu Ogah weekend called on all the Governors of the South East geopolitical zone of the country to decamp to APC and stop accusing the APC led government of marginalisation.

The post ‘We, Igbo, are the ones marginalising ourselves’ appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Photos: Egypt vs Nigeria in African Cup of Nations qualification match
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description: The post Photos: Egypt vs Nigeria in African Cup of Nations qualification match appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Cultists kill nine in Imo
item.dc:creator: adekunle
item.description:
There was mayhem at Ohaji- Egbema Local Government Area of Imo State weekend, when cultists killed nine people while avenging the killing of one their members by another rival group.

The post Cultists kill nine in Imo appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: APOLOGY OVER VIOLENT POLLS: Nigerians deserve the best, PDP leaders, others tell Buhari
item.dc:creator: Abiodun
item.description:
SOME Leaders and chieftains of the opposition Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, have advised President Muhammadu Buhari to go beyond apologies and give Nigerians credible and peaceful elections.

The post APOLOGY OVER VIOLENT POLLS: Nigerians deserve the best, PDP leaders, others tell Buhari appeared first on Vanguard News.

item.title: Share the votes not the bullets
item.dc:creator: johnabayomi2
item.description:
THE Rivers State electoral re-run was not an election; it was war and the generals on both sides lived up to the billing. Like in wars, manifestoes or programmes were unnecessary. The All Progressives Congress, APC and the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP simply told the voters that they were ready for the expected violence. There were pre-election shootings and bombing. It was a question of how many will be killed or maimed, how many wives will become widows, children that will become orphans, and families that will lose their loved ones. There was no pretense that the gladiators wanted peaceful polls.

The post Share the votes not the bullets appeared first on Vanguard News.
